item.title: RT Jacob Lee: ü§î A common misconception is that @LangChainAI JS/TS will bloat your web apps. But for common use-cases like RAG, it uses ~3.6% of a f...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
ü§î A common misconception is that @LangChainAI JS/TS will bloat your web apps.

But for common use-cases like RAG, it uses ~3.6% of a free-tier @vercel function's max size (37.32 KB/1 MB)!

Similar cost to using @supabase or overhead from @nextjs itself:

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain-nextjs-template?tab=readme-ov-file#-bundle-size
item.author: LangChain

item.title: It's easy to get a prototype of a RAG app up and running... but going to production is a lot harder ‚ùìIs the retrieval step messing up? Does the promp...
item.description:
It's easy to get a prototype of a RAG app up and running... but going to production is a lot harder

‚ùìIs the retrieval step messing up? Does the prompt need to be improved?

Debugging RAG apps can be complicated. @curious_kaylynn just published a great video on how to do it more‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747410933444698308

item.title: RT Lance Martin: Converting LLM chains to web endpoints Turning a LLM chain prototype into an web service can be a challenge. LangServe was designed t...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇLance Martin
Converting LLM chains to web endpoints

Turning a LLM chain prototype into an web service can be a challenge. LangServe was designed to enable this w/ minimal effort.

I made two code walk-through videos that show how to do this from scratch w/ LangServe for (1) a custom RAG‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747325957378330725
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Rapid deployment of LangServe templates: Neo4J Support for production has been one of the biggest needs we've heard consistently from developers. We'v...
item.description:
Rapid deployment of LangServe templates: Neo4J

Support for production has been one of the biggest needs we've heard consistently from developers.

We've added ~100 templates that work out-of-the-box as deployable apps using LangServe.

Today, we're releasing a hands-on video‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747311634878717995
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RAG with Pinecone Serverless Congrats to our friends at @pinecone for the recent launch of Pinecone Serverless! This has a few benefits for developers...
item.description:
RAG with Pinecone Serverless

Congrats to our friends at @pinecone for the recent launch of Pinecone Serverless!

This has a few benefits for developers, including usage-base-pricing (>10x lower costs), improved latency, and effortless scaling (no more pods or storage limits).‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747304822280491273

item.title: Good quick overview of how to build a question/answering app over audio data!
item.description:
Good quick overview of how to build a question/answering app over audio data!


Afiz ‚ö°Ô∏è:‚ÄÇBuild Question Answering AI App for Audio Data!

Today, we will see how we can build QnA AI app for Audio Data using @AssemblyAI, @LangChainAI and @OpenAI

In just 3 simple steps, we can achieve this.

Let's get started üöÄ

Just a couple of days ago, @LangChainAI released a 0.1.0 version ago with some package and syntax changes. To make it easier for you to integrate @neo4j with LangChain, I have updated my LLM notebooks to follow the new syntax and package structure.
